text: Anna Margaret "Annie" Glenn, (n√©e Castor; February 17, 1920 - May 19, 2020) was an American activist and philanthropist. She was the widow of former astronaut and Senator John Glenn. She was added into the National Stuttering Association Hall of Fame. She was known for her works to raise awareness of children and adults with disabilities such as stuttering. She suffered from it during her early years until it went away when she was in her 50s. Glenn was born in Columbus, Ohio. She studied at Muskingum College. Glenn married John Glenn in 1943. Together, they had two children. Glenn died at a nursing home in St. Paul, Minnesota on May 19, 2020 at the age of 100.Annie Glenn, widow of American icon John Glenn, dies at 100 The cause of death was COVID-19. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States Category:American civil rights activists Category:American centenarians Category:Philanthropists from Ohio Category:People from Columbus, Ohio
title: Annie Glenn
